"Botulinum toxin," which is often referred to by the brand name "Botox," is the primary chemical entity mentioned in the paragraph. It is a neurotoxin produced by the bacterium Clostridium botulinum. Botulinum toxin is used medically for various conditions, including adductor spasmodic dysphonia (ADSD), by weakening the targeted muscles through temporary muscle paralysis.
